titlestmt.titleproper: Lillian and Carl Forsgren contest scrapbooks
Guide to the Lillian and Carl Forsgren contest scrapbooks, 1936-1969 RL.11873
titlestmt.author: Richard Collier

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: Lillian and Carl Forsgren contest scrapbooks
did.abstract: Lillian and Carl Forsgren were a couple who lived in the Spokane and Seattle, Washington areas during the 20th century. The Lillian and Carl Forsgren contest scrapbooks include letters, contest announcements, entries, award notifications and other printed materials that document the couple's hobby of participating in marketing promotions and contests during the mid-twentieth century. The types of contests range from passive (enter to win) to participatory (requiring submissions of content including slogans, jingles, testimonials and recipes). Contest sponsors include the American Plywood Association, Coca-Cola, Coty, Dr. Pepper, the Ed Sullivan Show, Folger's, Frito-Lay, General Electric, General Mills, Helene Curtis, Kellogg, Kraft, Lever Brothers, Mennen, Pepsi, Purina, Stouffer's, and Westinghouse. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Lillian and Carl Forsgren were a couple who lived in the Spokane and Seattle, Washington areas during the 20th century. Lillian Ethel Johnson was born in 1900 in Minnesota. She married Carl Forsgren in Spokane, Wash. in 1925 and the couple eventually moved to Seattle. She died in Seattle in 2000. Carl Jonas Forsgren was born in Sweden in 1899. He emigrated to the United States in 1903 and naturalized around 1935. He worked for Ederer Engineering in Seattle during the 1940s. He died in Seattle in 1985. (Source: https://www.ancestrylibrary.com/)

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Lillian and Carl Forsgren contest scrapbooks were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a purchase in 2020.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Lillian and Carl Forsgren contest scrapbooks, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: 2021-0002.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in the following Hartman Center collections:
J. Walter Thompson Company. Account files;
J. Walter Thompson Company. Chicago Office. Information Center records;
J. Walter Thompson Company. Evan Peters scrapbook;
J. Walter Thompson Company. Newsletter collection;
J. Walter Thompson Company. Public relations records;
Pepperidge Farm advertising and promotional materials.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Lillian and Carl Forsgren contest scrapbooks include letters, contest announcements, entries, award notifications and other printed materials that document the couple's hobby of participating in marketing promotions and contests during the mid-twentieth century. The types of contests range from passive (enter to win) to participatory (requiring submissions of content including slogans, jingles, testimonials and recipes). Contest sponsors include the American Plywood Association, Coca-Cola, Coty, Dr. Pepper, the Ed Sullivan Show, Folger's, Frito-Lay, General Electric, General Mills, Helene Curtis, Kellogg, Kraft, Lever Brothers, Mennen, Pepsi, Purina, Stouffer's, and Westinghouse.
